page.title: 13CHURCHES
page.content: St Martins church was restored and re-built in{1882/83.}Much of the old church was kept.In the{19th century ,during rebuilding several old stones were found including fragments of a cross shaft and cross heads dating back to{850}to{1000}AD.Flat grave covers from the 13th century are built into the Vestry, chancel and the porch The two Norman arches still exist. Identification of the person buried is carved on graves e.g. priest-a chalice and missal.Although no trace of a building has been found it is thought that a church existed on this site-The 9th century.The vicar is the Rev. D. Moore who has been here for 13 years.St Hillary's church Picton is the daughter church of St Martin.It was built with brick and covered in plaster.It does not have a licence for burial or a graveyard.
